summary: In the early 20th century, cultivation of kiwifruit spread from China to New Zealand, where the first commercial plantings occurred. . Cultivation of kiwifruit spread from China in the early 20th century to New Zealand, where the first commercial plantings occurred. . In New Zealand and Australia, the word kiwi alone either refers solely to the bird or is used as a nickname for New Zealanders it is almost never used to refer to the fruit. . The fruit became popular with British and American servicemen stationed in New Zealand during World War II and was later exported, first to Great Britain and then to California in the 1960s. . Kiwifruit (often shortened to kiwi outside New Zealand and Australia) or Chinese gooseberry, or yangtao, is the edible berry of several species of woody vines in the genus Actinidia.
